snippet: The mammoth retailer finds that its efforts to upend the traditional publishing model have unintended consequences.
abstract: Amazon's publishing arm is getting pushback from many booksellers, who are scorning the imprint's most prominent title, Timothy Ferriss's The 4-Hour Chef; Barnes & Noble, struggling to remain relevant in Amazon's shadow, is not carrying its competitor's books; other large physical and digital stores seem to be uninterested or even opposed to Ferriss's book.
lead_paragraph: The mammoth retailer finds that its efforts to upend the traditional publishing model have unintended consequences.

headline.seo: Shunning Amazon, Booksellers Resist a Transformation
